title.rendered: Vaughan Storage Solutions: 3 Benefits of a Built-In Bookshelf

content.rendered:
Bookshelves aren’t just for books anymore. Adding a built-in bookshelf is one small way to get big results for your home. Custom built-ins can provide oodles of storage solutions to keep your living areas neat and organized, even with kids and pets. Shelving can also increase your home value when it comes time to put your house back on the market for resale. While you’re still living there, you can enjoy increased space in even smaller living areas that are free from clutter. Find out more about the three benefits of built-in bookshelves for your home and who to call for home renovations in Vaughan.

Storage Solutions in Vaughan

“There’s plenty of storage here,” said no homeowner ever. Even with the best plans, homeowners could always use more storage. This need for expert storage solutions only grows more significant with expanding families that accommodate the needs of kids and pets.

Toys

Built-ins can be custom-made so that the bottom of the shelving has cabinets to store away messy toy boxes. So long as kids can get the toys back in the cupboard and off of the floor, anyone should consider it a job well done.

Display

Other items such as family photos, trophies, and awards no longer have to be relegated to a bottom drawer or a box. All of your sentimental items can go out on display rather than taking up room in the garage.

Safety

While kid-friendly spaces are better for bottom cabinets, fragile, breakable, or irreplaceable items that should be kept away from developing motor reflexes can be safely stored on top shelves. You might also choose to store some of the louder, more annoying noise-making toys on the top shelf until some, ahem, later time for safekeeping, of course.

Resale Solutions in Vaughan

Built-in shelving doesn’t only benefit your family with storage solutions and versatile display options. Whenever you decide to put your home on the market in the future, potential buyers will consider built-in shelving just as valuable as you do.

Options

While planning for your built-ins, flexibility and versatility are considerations. Some modular built-ins are easier to customize and move around than others. If you truly want to maximize the potential of the shelving for resale value, consider flexible shelving.

Entertainment

Depending on the shelving setup, future owners can use it for entertainment setup. Shelving should be strong enough and wired enough to accommodate: 

  • Computers
  • Televisions
  • Speakers 
  • Surround sound
  • Monitors
  • Projectors 
  • Consoles 
  • Smart technology

Shelving

If shelving is stationary rather than flexible, be sure to style it in the most flexible ways to show potential buyers that it can be used for more than one purpose. For many, when they see built-in bookshelves, they wonder how they might fill so much space without an entire library at their disposal. Different ways to optimize storage and display include: 

  • Baskets
  • Plants 
  • Bins 
  • Art 
  • Blankets 
  • Sculptures 
  • Bar sets 
  • Pillows 

Space Solutions in Vaughan

Custom built-ins are especially advantageous for smaller living areas and studies. Since built-in bookshelves mirror the efforts of big-city architects and build up rather than out, space is maximized where otherwise it would be wasted.

Different Benefits for Different Spaces

Smaller spaces indeed get more floor space from built-ins. However, larger rooms are granted greater depth. Deep built-ins are an ideal alternative for those unsure how to fill large living areas and who don’t like the idea of massive or bountiful furniture.

Built-in bookshelving comes in a variety of different prefabricated designs and styles. However, custom built-ins are equally, if not more practical, for homeowners who want storage solutions to meet their specific needs. For more information on the next steps for the built-in bookshelf project you’ve been dreaming of, contact the professionals at Handyman Connection today.
